III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Consultant spoke with the administration team to make sure all human resource
documents are located within one place. This includes the emails from human
resource completing their review on a potential employee that has criminal history
to be in compliance with rule 400.4113 (g). Consultant also provided feedback on
the employee form that is completed by the employee if there is criminal history
found for the employee to provide more of narrative about the criminal convictions
of what occurred, timeframe, and growth.
2

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• During the time of the onsite visit, there was no consultation requested or
required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 3 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
- 2024 Renewal: Correction Action Plan was recorded during this reporting period
as a result of the Renewal inspection completed on 01/10/2024. The CAP
contained one violation of CCI Rule 400.4113 (1)(i) in that there were one out of
four new employees that did not have documentation of verification the employee
has not been determined to be perpetrator of child abuse or neglect within the
appropriate time frame. The CAP contained action items to ensure that individuals
were properly screened for child abuse and neglect clearances in the appropriate
amount of time prior to hire.
- Special Investigation 2024C0001047SI with CAP approval date of 02/09/2024
was a result of a violation for staff not following the restraint policy and picked a
youth off the ground. The facility had terminated the staff that was involved in the
situation and completed a refresher training with all staff about the restraint model.
The facility successfully completed all the action steps within their approved CAP.
-Special Investigation 2024SIC0001478 with CAP approval date of 08/02/2024
was a result of a violation for staff not following the facility's supervision policy and
specific youth supervision guidelines. The facility has updated their policy and
procedures as it pertains to supervision requirements, specifically with 1:1
supervision. The facility has also added to their weekly team meetings the review
of each youth's supervision level with the staff. The facility is currently complying
with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor CAP compliance with
no noted concerns.
3

Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit. It should be noted the 2024 financial audit
for the agency will not be completed until May 2025.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator completed the Chief Administrator Assessment report on
December 2, 2024. Over the past year, turnover continues to be a barrier as the
facility is constantly hiring staff that have come with varying levels of experience
needing additional support and training. The facility continues to work on their
relationship with the local school district as they sometimes pose barriers to
working with the youth's behaviors. The facility has been providing staffing support
at the school to try to eliminate this barrier. Over the next year, the facility continues
to meet regularly as an administration team and provide monthly training for staff.
There will continue to be routine team meetings to ensure staff are being provided
necessary information to meet requirements and safety of the youth they serve.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Three direct care staff were interviewed during the inspection and reported feeling
well equipped to do their jobs. Staff reported they feel well supported by their team
leads, direct supervisor, and administration team. Staff reported they are working
on having clearer communication amongst themselves as a team as it pertains to
job responsibilities and supervision during a shift.
Three youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or
concerns were raised. The youth reported they feel safe with staff and have a
positive relationship with staff. Youth reported staff only goes hands on with a youth
when they are being truly unsafe to themselves or others.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on December 16,
2024. There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
